Title: Internet providers to act against online pirates,US Internet providers to act against online pirates,Varney to step down as top antitrust official,UPDATE 2-Varney to step down as top U.S. antitrust official
Body: LOS ANGELES Consumers who illegally download copyrighted films, music or television shows might see their Internet speed slowed or access restricted under an industry anti-piracy effort announced on Thursday., * Illegal downloading could lead to temporary restrictions,WASHINGTON Christine Varney, the top antitrust official in the U.S. Justice Department, is stepping down, the department said on Wednesday., * Experts do not expect sharp change in antitrust policy

Title: U.S. Internet providers to act against online pirates
Body: LOS ANGELES Consumers who illegally download copyrighted films, music or television shows might see their Internet speed slowed or access restricted under an industry anti-piracy effort announced on Thursday.

Title: Courts OK Nortel patent sale to Apple/RIM group,UPDATE 3-Courts OK Nortel patent sale to Apple/RIM group
Body: WILMINGTON, Delaware Apple Inc, Microsoft Corp, Research in Motion Ltd and three other leading tech companies received court approval on Monday to buy wireless patents from bankrupt Nortel Networks Corp for $4.5 billion., * Money goes to paying off Nortel debts (Adds background on antitrust concerns in paragraph 16)

Title: Regulators combat unauthorized phone bill fees,US regulators combat unauthorized phone bill fees
Body: WASHINGTON Telephone companies would have to make third-party charges on landline phone bills clear and distinct to help people detect unauthorized fees under rules proposed on Tuesday by communications regulators., * Companies would have to make third-party charges clear

Body: (Corrects copper prices by adding missing decimal point infifth paragraph),STOCKHOLM, July 14 - Swedish regulators have raided U.S.-owned bourse operator Nasdaq OMX Group in a competition probe likely to raise questions over exchanges' efforts to woo controversial high-frequency traders., * Complaint involves Verizon data centre (Adds detail, background, Verizon comment),STOCKHOLM Swedish regulators have raided leading local bourse operator Nasdaq OMX Group  in a competition probe sparked by a complaint from a small local rival, officials said on Thursday., The International Monetary Fund said the Greek sovereigndebt burden could spiral out of control and that it would beappropriate for private bondholders to share in anyrestructuring. http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/fdd18148-ad72-11e0-bc4f-00144feabdc0.html#axzz1RvODm5Bi, LONDON, July 14 Sweden's regulators have raidedthe country's stock exchange as part of an investigation intowhether Nasdaq OMX  is trying to suppress competitionfrom rival trading platforms in the region, the Financial Timesreported on Thursday.

Title: UPDATE 1-Connecticut unionized workers OK labor contract-Gov
Body: NEW YORK, Aug 18 Connecticut's unionized stateworkers ratified a new cost-cutting contract, accepting biggerpenalties for retiring early and agreeing to help pay forhealthcare, just four days before thousands of lay-offs wouldhave taken effect, the governor said on Thursday.

Title: Corvex's Meister likes TW Telecom, says possible takeover target

Title: Verizon Wireless to pay parents surprise $7 billion dividend
Body: Verizon Wireless, the biggest U.S. mobile service provider, said on Monday it would pay its parents Verizon Communications and Vodafone Group Plc a dividend of $7 billion in June, surprising some analysts who had not expected a big payout.

Title: BUYOUTS-Miami entrepreneur seeks $250 mln for debut cybersecurity
Body: NEW YORK, May 15 (Reuters-BUYOUTS) - Miami-basedentrepreneur Manuel "Manny" Medina of Medina Capital has linedup an estimated $50 million from family and friends as part ofan effort to raise $250 million for a debut private equity fund,a source said. It has been about two years since Medina sold hisinformation technology company Terremark Worldwide to VerizonCommunications Inc. in a deal valued at $2 billion.

Title: Verizon exec says tech firms 'grandstanding' over NSA -report
Body: NEW YORK, Sept 18 A senior executive for VerizonCommunications Inc has accused U.S. technology companiesof "grandstanding" in public comments about their forcedcooperation with U.S. spy agencies, according to a report bytechnology news website ZDNet.com.

Title: Verizon nears $130 billion wireless deal, to finance about $65 billion: sources,Verizon nears $130 bln wireless deal, to finance about $65 bln-sources
Body: Verizon Communications is near a $130 billion deal to buy out the 45 percent stake in Verizon Wireless it does not already own from Vodafone Group Plc and plans to raise about $65 billion to fund the purchase, people familiar with the matter said on Saturday.,Aug 31 Verizon Communications is near a$130 billion deal to buy out the 45 percent stake in VerizonWireless it does not already own from Vodafone Group Plc and plans to raise about $65 billion to fund the purchase,people familiar with the matter said on Saturday.

Title: No big foreign telecoms in Canada auction, boosting domestics
Body: OTTAWA Major foreign telecommunications companies have decided against registering for a Canadian wireless spectrum auction, in a setback for the government's plans to introduce more competition into the mobile telephone sector.

Title: Sprint, T-Mobile join Verizon in snub of Canada airwaves
Body: TORONTO/NEW YORK Sprint Corp and T-Mobile US Inc confirmed on Thursday they will not participate in Canada's upcoming auction of prized wireless spectrum, joining larger rival Verizon Communications Inc in shunning the market.

Title: M&A flat so far this year, even with mammoth Verizon deal,DEALS-M&A flat so far this year, even with mammoth Verizon deal
Body: NEW YORK Dealmaking around the world was basically flat over the first nine months of the year, a disappointing level given the $130 billion Verizon Communications Inc  transaction that bolstered mergers and acquisition volumes in the third quarter.,* U.S. M&A up 35 pct, Europe down 24 pct, Asia dropped 8 pct

Title: UPDATE 1-Telecom tycoon says Ottawa's policy imperils Wind, foreign investment,Egyptian tycoon says Wind Mobile in peril due to Ottawa policy,Egyptian tycoon says Wind Mobile in peril due to Ottawa policy
Body: TORONTO, Oct 16 Lack of clarity around Ottawa'stelecommunications policy has jeopardized foreign investment inCanada and cast doubt over the future of Wind, the largest newplayer in the Canadian wireless market, said Egyptian telecommagnate Naguib Sawiris on Wednesday.,TORONTO Egyptian telecom magnate Naguib Sawiris said on Wednesday the lack of clarity around Ottawa's telecom policy has put Wind Mobile, the largest new entrant in the Canadian wireless market, at risk of going bust.,TORONTO, Oct 16 Egyptian telecom magnate NaguibSawiris said on Wednesday the lack of clarity around Ottawa'stelecom policy has put Wind Mobile, the largest new entrant inthe Canadian wireless market, at risk of going bust.

Title: Vodafone CFO Halford to leave next year,UPDATE 1-Vodafone CFO Halford to leave next year
Body: LONDON Britain's Vodafone  said on Thursday its chief financial officer Andy Halford will leave the group next year after the completion of its $130 billion deal to sell its U.S. wireless business to Verizon Communications Inc .,LONDON, Oct 3 Britain's Vodafone said onThursday its chief financial officer Andy Halford will leave thegroup next year after the completion of its $130 billion deal tosell its U.S. wireless business to Verizon Communications Inc.

Title: Verizon plans European investor meetings in November
Body: LONDON, Nov 7 (IFR) - Verizon Communications is planning tomeet European fixed income investors in November in preparationfor a bond transaction that is expected to take place in the NewYear, according to market sources.

Title: CenturyLink boosts cloud offerings with Tier 3 buy,CenturyLink boosts cloud offerings with Tier 3 buy
Body: Telecommunications company CenturyLink Inc said on Tuesday it has bought cloud computing startup Tier 3 Inc as part of its acquisition strategy that allows it to compete with the likes of Amazon Inc, IBM Corp and Verizon Communications Inc's Terremark.,Nov 19 Telecommunications company CenturyLinkInc said on Tuesday it has bought cloud computingstartup Tier 3 Inc as part of its acquisition strategy thatallows it to compete with the likes of Amazon Inc, IBMCorp and Verizon Communications Inc's Terremark.

Title: INSIGHT-For Intel, Hollywood dreams prove a leap too far
Body: Nov 20 Earlier this year, Intel Corp rentedtemporary retail space in New York, Los Angeles and Chicago fora splashy launch of Intel TV, a new Internet entertainmentservice that the chipmaker promised could revolutionize thetelevision industry.

Title: UPDATE 1-U.S. regulators to consider in-flight calls, text messaging
Body: WASHINGTON/ATLANTA, Nov 21 The U.S. FederalCommunications Commission is considering allowing airplanepassengers to use their cellphones for calls and text messagingduring flights, setting up a challenging debate over technicaland social implications.

Title: Troubled HealthCare.gov to switch U.S. Web hosts after contract change
Body: WASHINGTON, Nov 27 The U.S. government isswitching providers of Web hosting services for the troubledHealthCare.gov website, replacing Verizon Communications Inc's Terremark subsidiary with  Hewlett-Packard Co,the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services said onWednesday.

Title: UPDATE 2-Sprint promises higher data speeds than rivals,Intel looking to exit TV project, in talks with Verizon,UPDATE 1-Intel looking to exit TV project, in talks with Verizon,EU mergers and takeovers (Oct 30),Intel looking to exit TV business -report,CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Connecticut says U.S. Obamacare data hub 'experiencing an outage'
Body: BURLINGAME, Calif., Oct 30 Sprint Corp promised to gradually offer wireless data speeds far in excessof those offered by bigger rivals like Verizon, as it hopes touse recently acquired wireless airwaves to regain market share.,Chipmaker Intel Corp is having second thoughts about getting into the television business and is in talks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over its Internet TV initiative, a source familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.,Oct 30 Chipmaker Intel Corp is havingsecond thoughts about getting into the television business andis in talks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over itsInternet TV initiative, a source familiar with the matter saidon Wednesday.,BRUSSELS, Oct 30 The following are mergers underreview by the European Commission and a brief guide to the EUmerger process:,Oct 30 Chipmaker Intel Corp is havingsecond thoughts about its nascent television service and is intalks with Verizon Communications Inc to take over the business,according to a report on tech website All Things D, citingpeople familiar with the matter.,(Corrects 2nd paragraph to make clear Verizon is the operatorof the data hub, not the exchange)

Title: Dish, smaller carriers plan bids for H block spectrum auction,Dish, smaller carriers plan bids for H block spectrum auction
Body: WASHINGTON Dish Network Corp will compete against smaller wireless carriers and individual investors in the U.S. Federal Communications Commission auction of spectrum scheduled for January, the agency revealed on Wednesday.,WASHINGTON, Dec 4 Dish Network Corp will compete against smaller wireless carriers and individualinvestors in the U.S. Federal Communications Commission auctionof spectrum scheduled for January, the agency revealed onWednesday.

Title: Vodafone sees Verizon deal finalized around early March,Vodafone sees Verizon deal finalized around early March
Body: NEW YORK Vodafone Group Plc  expects to close the $130 billion sale of its 45 percent stake in Verizon Wireless to Verizon Communications  and that shareholders will have received the proceeds of the deal by early March in line with the companies' target for a first quarter close.,NEW YORK, Dec 10 Vodafone Group Plc expects to close the $130 billion sale of its 45 percent stakein Verizon Wireless to Verizon Communications and thatshareholders will have received the proceeds of the deal byearly March in line with the companies' target for a firstquarter close.

Title: Verizon takes hard line on surveillance vote: activists,UPDATE 1-Verizon takes hard line on surveillance vote -activists
Body: BOSTON Verizon Communications Inc told activist investors on Wednesday that it might skip a vote on a shareholder proposal that seeks details on the company's cooperation with government surveillance efforts.,BOSTON, Dec 11 Verizon Communications Inc told activist investors on Wednesday that it might skip a voteon a shareholder proposal that seeks details on the company'scooperation with government surveillance efforts.

Title: UPDATE 1-Verizon to detail government information requests,Verizon to detail government information requests
Body: Dec 19 Verizon Communications Inc said itwould regularly report information on government requests forcustomer data from now on, following pressure from activistshareholders.,Dec 19 Verizon Communications Inc said itwould publish a report that will provide data on the number ofrequests for customer information that it received in 2013 fromthe governments of countries where it does business.

Title: Canada to cap domestic wireless roaming rates
Body: TORONTO Canada will introduce legislation to cap roaming rates that big telecom providers charge their smaller rivals, the government said on Wednesday, aiming to breathe life into its sputtering drive to foster competition in the wireless industry.

Title: AT&T to join Verizon in government data-request disclosures,AT&T to join Verizon in government data-request disclosures,UPDATE 2-Under pressure, Verizon plans more data-request disclosures
Body: AT&T Inc will join rival Verizon Communications in disclosing details on government requests for customer data starting in 2014, after investors called on the two largest U.S. carriers to reveal more about controversial spying operations.,Dec 20 AT&T Inc will join rival VerizonCommunications in disclosing details on governmentrequests for customer data starting in 2014, after investorscalled on the two largest U.S. carriers to reveal more aboutcontroversial spying operations.,Dec 19 Verizon Communications Inc vowedto issue semi-annual reports on government requests for customerdata, drawing praise from privacy advocates who sought suchchanges and marking the latest reform to controversialsurveillance practices.

Title: S&P 500 ends near flat; retailers fly for a second day
Body: NEW YORK Stocks finished flat on Wednesday with investors hesitant to make a big move on the day before comments from Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen, though retailers' shares rallied on results for a second day. |Â

Title: Fitch Rates Verizon's $6.6B Term Loans 'A-'; Outlook Stable

(NYSE:VZ):--$3.3 billion term loan due 2017;--$3.3 billion term loan due 2019;--$2 billion 364-day revolving credit facility due February2015.Fitch currently rates VZ's IDR 'A-' with a Stable RatingOutlook.Proceeds from the term loans formed part of the $130 billion inconsideration used to acquir

Title: S&P 500 ends at record after Yellen's weather talk,PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Feb 27
Body: NEW YORK The S&P 500 closed at a record on Thursday and ended in positive territory for the year after Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen said harsh weather seems to be to behind recent U.S. economic softness. |Â ,Feb 27 The following are the top stories in theWall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories anddoes not vouch for their accuracy.

Title: U.S. seeks trials to test transition to digital phone networks
Body: WASHINGTON, Jan 30 U.S. wireless providers likeAT&T Inc and Verizon Communications Inc on Thursdayreceived a nod from regulators to test a transition of thetelephone industry away from traditional analog networks todigital ones.

Title: Verizon in talks with content providers for online video service,Verizon in talks with content providers for online video service
Body: NEW YORK Verizon Communications is in talks with content providers to deliver web-based TV services to mobile platforms, chief executive Lowell McAdam, said at an investor conference on Tuesday.,NEW YORK, March 4 Verizon Communications is in talks with content providers to deliver web-based TVservices to mobile platforms, chief executive Lowell McAdam,said at an investor conference on Tuesday.

Title: Fitch Rates Verizon Communications' Proposed Debt Issue 'A-'; Outlook Stable,Orders for Verizon dollar bond over USD9bn
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)CHICAGO, March 10 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A-'rating to Verizon Communications Inc.'s (NYSE: VZ) proposed senior unsecured debtoffering.Fitch currently rates VZ's IDR 'A-' with a Stable RatingOutlook.Proceeds from the notes will be used to fund notes tendered inconnection with concurrent, March 10, 2014 tender offers for up to $8.2 billionof outstanding higher-cost debt previously issued by VZ or certain of itss,NEW YORK, March 10 (IFR) - Verizon Communications hasalready attracted more than USD9bn of orders for a five-part USdollar-denominated benchmark bond issue that will fund a tenderof its existing debt and push out maturities, according tomarket sources.

Title: UPDATE 2-Target says it declined to act on early alert of cyber breach
Body: BOSTON/WASHINGTON, March 13 Target Corp's security software detected potentially maliciousactivity during last year's massive data breach, but its staffdecided not to take immediate action, the No. 3. U.S. retailersaid on Thursday.

Title: SoftBank CEO says still keen to merge U.S. Sprint and T-Mobile
Body: March 11 Japan's SoftBank Corp is stilltrying to buy T-Mobile US Inc and merge it with itsU.S. wireless carrier Sprint Corp, SoftBank CEO MasayoshiSon said, even though U.S. regulators appear set against a deal.

Title: U.S. extends Terremark contract as HealthCare.gov host,U.S. extends Terremark contract as HealthCare.gov host
Body: WASHINGTON The Obama administration said on Friday Verizon Communications Inc's Terremark unit will remain under contract as host of the federal website HealthCare.gov to better ensure a smooth end to Obamacare's open enrollment period on March 31.,WASHINGTON, March 7 The Obama administrationsaid on Friday Verizon Communications Inc's Terremarkunit will remain under contract as host of the federal websiteHealthCare.gov to better ensure a smooth end to Obamacare's openenrollment period on March 31.

Title: DEALTALK-Softbank CEO's merger plans for Sprint, T-Mobile face long odds
Body: NEW YORK, March 5 Masayoshi Son isn't used totaking no for an answer. But the Softbank Corp chief'spleas for a merger of the third- and fourth-largest U.S.wireless carriers seem to be falling on deaf ears.

Body: WASHINGTON U.S. regulators will review agreements between Netflix, Verizon, Comcast and other content and Internet providers to figure out whether they are causing slow web download speeds for some consumers, especially for streaming video content.,WASHINGTON, June 13 U.S. regulators will reviewagreements between Netflix, Verizon, Comcast and other contentand Internet providers to figure out whether they are causingslow web download speeds for some consumers, especially forstreaming video content.,WASHINGTON, June 13 The Federal CommunicationsCommission is collecting information on the terms of Internettraffic exchange agreements between Netflix and Verizon andComcast and others, to begin to review such agreements, FCCChairman Tom Wheeler said on Friday.

Title: Quebec seeks C$409 mln from rail operator for Lac-Megantic disaster
Body: TORONTO, June 16 The Quebec government said onMonday it was seeking some C$409 million ($377 million) fromMontreal, Maine and Atlantic, the insolvent rail operator at thecenter of the rail disaster in the town of Lac Megantic lastyear.

Body: WASHINGTON, Aug 4 Verizon Communications Inc defended its decision to slow data downloads for somecustomers using older unlimited data plans, telling U.S.regulators it was a "widely accepted" and lawful part of networkmanagement.

Body: WASHINGTON, Aug 5 The U.S. FederalCommunications Commission on Tuesday proposed changing how itmeasures high-speed Internet to potentially require downloadspeeds of 10 megabits per second (Mbps) or higher for a serviceto qualify as broadband.,WASHINGTON, Aug 5 The U.S. FederalCommunications Commission on Tuesday proposed changing thedefinition of high-speed Internet to require download speeds of10 megabits per second (Mbps) or higher to qualify as broadband.

Body: March 11 Verizon Communications Inc willoffer more than 200 hours a year of original online programmingfrom DreamWorks Animation and its AwesomenessTV unit ina bid to reach families and younger viewers who increasinglywatch video on mobile devices, the companies said on Wednesday.

Body: NEW YORK Nearly 40,000 Verizon workers walked off the job on Wednesday in one of the largest U.S. strikes in recent years after contract talks hit an impasse, and got a boost as U.S. Democratic presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders joined them at a Brooklyn rally ahead of the New York primary next week. |Â ,NEW YORK, April 13 Nearly 40,000 Verizon workerswalked off the job on Wednesday in one of the largest U.S.strikes in recent years after contract talks hit an impasse, andgot a boost as U.S. Democratic presidential hopeful BernieSanders joined them at a Brooklyn rally ahead of the New Yorkprimary next week.,NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Verizon Communications workers are bolstering unions' cautious comeback. Thetelecom company's staff walked out in one of the largest U.S.strikes in years after contract talks stalled. Add a SupremeCourt win, minimum-wage hikes and a big role in presidentialraces, and organized labor's future begins to look a bitbrighter.,* CWA and IBEW leaders call strike against verizon and itscustomers,* Verizon workers to strike to save good jobs and ensure quality service for customers

Title: WRAPUP 6-Weak U.S. employment report dims prospect of Fed rate hike,WRAPUP 1-U.S. job gains in May likely dented by Verizon strike
Body: WASHINGTON, June 3 The U.S. economy created thefewest number of jobs in more than 5-1/2-years in May asmanufacturing and construction employment fell sharply, whichcould make it harder for the Federal Reserve to raise interestrates.,WASHINGTON, June 3 A strike by Verizon workers likely crimped U.S. job gains in May, but employmentgrowth should still be strong enough to confirm a tighteninglabor market and push the Federal Reserve closer to raisinginterest rates soon.

Title: Bytes and barrels: the origins of oil traders' love of Yahoo
Body: NEW YORK, July 28 For the oil industry, YahooInc's decision this week to sell its core business toVerizon Communications Inc for $4.8 billion does notmatter all that much. Their world already changed a few monthsago, when the company said it would jettison its messagingsystem that has been the norm for oil traders since the late1990s.

Title: Fitch Rates Verizon's Sr. Unsecured Note Offering 'A-'; Outlook Stable
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)CHICAGO, September 06 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'A-'rating to Verizon Communications Inc.'s (Verizon; NYSE: VZ) $2.059 billionof senior unsecured 4.2% notes due 2046. Proceeds will be used to repaythe $870 million principal balance of the 4.8% notes due 2044, as well as forgeneral corporate purposes. Body: WASHINGTON Verizon Communications Inc said on Thursday it has a "reasonable basis" to believe YahooInc's massive data breach of email accounts representsa material impact that could allow Verizon to withdraw from its$4.83 billion deal to buy the technology company.,WASHINGTON, Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc said on Thursday it has a "reasonable basis" to believeYahoo Inc's massive data breach of email accountsrepresents a material impact that could allow Verizon towithdraw from its $4.83 billion deal to buy the technologycompany.,WASHINGTON, Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc general counsel, Craig Silliman, said on Thursday thecompany has a "reasonable basis" to believe that Yahoo Inc's massive data breach of at least 500 million emailaccounts represents a material impact that could allow Verizonto withdraw from its $4.83 billion deal to buy Yahoo.,Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc said onThursday it plans to close call centers in five states,including its home state of New York, as the No. 1 wirelesscompany trims head count and reorganizes operations in asaturated wireless market.,Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc, theNo. 1 U.S. wireless company, said on Thursday it would closecall centers in five states, including its home state of NewYork.,* Verizon is closing call centers in five states, includingits home state of new york - NYT

Title: U.S. funds downbeat on AT&T even before Time Warner deal
Body: BOSTON, Oct 25 Many actively managed U.S. mutualfunds were cool toward AT&T Inc even before the telecomgiant's planned $85.4 billion acquisition of Time Warner Inc.

Title: Yahoo hacks out more wiggle room for Verizon
Body: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Yahoo is hacking out more wiggle room for Verizon. The beleaguered internet firm waited until the day after the U.S. election to reveal a hacker's July claim to have certain user data. That's when it inked a $4.8 billion sale to the telecommunications giant. The latest hit to Yahoo's reputation gives Verizon extra firepower to snag a better deal.

Title: Business Watch: A first for Verizon,Verizon profit, revenue miss Wall Street view as subscribers dash,Verizon's M&A signal comes in a little clearer,UPDATE 4-Verizon profit, revenue miss Wall Street view as subscribers dash,BRIEF-Verizon Communications Q1 earnings per share $0.84,Verizon reports 20 pct fall in quarterly profit
Body: Verizon reported its first-ever quarterly loss of subscribers, even as it offered an unlimited data plan in an attempt to fend off smaller rivals like T-Mobile US and Sprint.,Verizon Communications Inc  on Thursday reported its first-ever quarterly loss of subscribers, even as it offered an unlimited data plan, raising questions on whether the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier may need a larger acquisition than Yahoo to diversify its business. |Â ,NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Verizon's M&A signal is starting to come in a little clearer. The U.S. telecommunications titan reported a 20 percent drop in quarterly profit as a new sales initiative failed to attract customers. Its strategy behind buying AOL and Yahoo is perplexing. All of it probably helps explain why Chief Executive Lowell McAdam just indicated he's open to the idea of a bigger deal.,April 20 Verizon Communications Inc onThursday reported its first-ever quarterly loss of subscribers,even as it offered an unlimited data plan, raising questions onwhether the No. 1 U.S. wireless carrier may need a largeracquisition than Yahoo to diversify its business.,* Q1 revenue $29.8 billion versus i/b/e/s view $30.77billion,April 20 Verizon Communications Inc, theNo. 1 U.S. wireless carrier, reported a 20 percent fall inquarterly profit as it lost wireless postpaid subscribersdespite the re-launch of unlimited data plans.

Title: Wal-Mart not in Carrefour Brazil unit talks: source,UPDATE 2-Wal-Mart not in Carrefour Brazil unit talks -source,Carrefour not in Brazil talks with Wal-Mart -source,UPDATE 1-TPG gets control of Russia's Lenta-sources,Wal-Mart in talks for Carrefour Brazil unit - report,TPG, EBRD, VTB Capital buy 44 pct of Russia's Lenta
Body: SAO PAULO/PARIS Wal-Mart Stores , the world's biggest retailer, is not in talks to buy French rival Carrefour's  unit in Brazil, a source familiar with the situation said, denying a press report., * Wal-Mart Stores mulls purchase to expand in Brazil -report, PARIS, Aug 9 French retailer Carrefour is not in talks to sell its Brazil operations to Wal-Mart StoresInc , and a press report claiming such negotiations wereunderway is false, a person close to the situation said onTuesday., * TPG, VTB Capital, EBRD buy out main owner and associates, SAO PAULO, Aug 9 Wal-Mart Stores , theworld's biggest retailer, is in talks to buy French rivalCarrefour's unit in Brazil, in a move that would makethe U.S. giant the largest supermarket chain in the SouthAmerican country, Valor Economico newspaper reported on Tuesday., MOSCOW/ST PETERSBURG, Russia, Aug 9 U.S. privateequity firm TPG, Russia's VTB Capital and the EBRD signed a $1.1billion deal to buy 44 percent of St Petersburg-based retailerLenta from its main owner August Meyer, sources told Reuters.

Title: Murdoch and son get big bonuses, James declines
Body: NEW YORK News Corp awarded Rupert Murdoch and his son James big compensation increases, though James declined his bonus, citing controversy over a phone hacking scandal at the UK newspaper unit that he oversees.

Title: Chile retailer SMU buys Supermercados del Sur
Body: SANTIAGO, Sept 18 Chile's Grupo SMU, owner ofthe country's No. 3 supermarket chain, said on Sunday it hadbought store chain Supermercados del Sur to increase itsbusiness in a fiercely competitive retail field.

Body: Walmart shares tumbled nearly 5 percent and sharesin its Mexican business dropped even further as allegations ofbribery and a cover-up shook the U.S. retailer.,CHICAGO/MEXICO CITY Wal-Mart Stores Inc lost $10 billion of its market value on Monday on concerns that a bribery investigation in Mexico could be very costly and hinder its plans to grow. |Â ,NEW YORK The follow-up to the New York Times' blockbuster scoop on Wal-Mart's alleged cover-up of $24 million in Mexican bribes has, quite rightly, focused on the company's potential Foreign Corrupt Practices Act exposure. But that's not the only law Wal-Mart and its executives should be worrying about.,MEXICO CITY The front-runner for Mexico's presidency and lawmakers on Monday called on authorities to investigate allegations of bribery at the Mexican unit of Wal-Mart Stores Inc, though prosecutors said it may not be a federal matter.,Two Democratic U.S. lawmakers on Monday said they were launching an investigation into allegations of bribery at Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Mexican affiliate.,* Federal investigation seen unlikely but AG willing to act,* Say launching investigation after New York Time article,NEW YORK, April 23 The options market showstraders expect Wal-Mart shares to resume this year's rallydespite falling on Monday on a news report that the world'slargest retailer stymied a probe into allegations of bribery atits Mexican affiliate, Wal-Mart de Mexico.,NEW YORK Investors pushed global equities and the euro lower on Monday as Dutch political turmoil and disappointing euro zone data revived fears the region's debt crisis could keep much of Europe mired in recession through the year.,NEW YORK Stocks fell on Monday as political turmoil in Europe cast doubts on the euro zone's ability to push through measures to end its debt crisis and as Wal-Mart sank following a report it stymied a bribery probe. |Â

According to U.S. law, it might not be a bribe if a company paid a little something under the table to a foreign official to encourage him to speed up a permit that he would have issued anyway.,WILMINGTON, Del A shareholder sued the board and several officers of Wal-Mart Stores Inc  on Wednesday over allegations that the company's Mexican affiliate paid bribes to local officials, adding to the company's legal problems.,WILMINGTON, Del, April 25 A shareholder sued theboard and several officers of Wal-Mart Stores Inc onWednesday over allegations that the company's Mexican affiliatepaid bribes to local officials, adding to the company's legalproblems.,MEXICO CITY Mexico's federal comptroller's office said on Wednesday it would open an investigation into allegations that the Mexican unit of Wal-Mart Stores Inc bribed officials to expand its business in Mexico.,MEXICO CITY, April 25 Mexico's federalcomptroller's office said on Wednesday it would open aninvestigation into allegations that the Mexican unit of Wal-MartStores Inc bribed officials to expand its business in Mexico.,WILMINGTON, Del, April 25 A shareholder sued theboard and several officers of Wal-Mart Stores Inc onWednesday over allegations that the company's Mexican affiliatepaid bribes to local officials.,Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Wednesday that it named a former attorney earlier this year to oversee global compliance with a bribery law, as it deals with the fallout over alleged bribes in Mexico that recently came to light.,April 25 Wal-Mart Stores Inc onWednesday said the internal lawyer serving as its globalcompliance officer on foreign corrupt practices act issues isTom Gean, and gave details on the external teams helping withits ongoing investigations.

Title: Walmart moves "Black Friday" earlier on Thanksgiving,Walmart moves "Black Friday" earlier on Thanksgiving night
Body: "Black Friday" arrives earlier than ever at Walmart this year, with customers barely getting to digest Thanksgiving dinner before holiday shopping kicks off at 8 p.m. local time.,Walmart will kick off its holiday sales rush at 8 p.m. on Thanksgiving, its earliest start ever, and will guarantee that those who line up can buy a trio of gadgets as it places a big bet that shoppers are ready to spend this holiday season.

Title: Consumer sentiment at five-year high; inventories jump
Body: NEW YORK An increasingly upbeat view of the economy and jobs market drove U.S. consumer sentiment to a more than five-year high in early November, while a jump in wholesale inventories suggested the economy grew more than initially estimated last quarter.

Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc on Tuesday said it would pay nearly $81.63 million to the federal government as it pleaded guilty to charges that it improperly discarded hazardous waste such as bleach and fertilizer years ago.

Title: PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - May 29
Body: May 29 The following are the top stories in theFinancial Times. Reuters has not verified these stories and doesnot vouch for their accuracy.

Title: Walmart offers fresh produce guarantee to shoppers,Walmart offers fresh produce guarantee to U.S. shoppers
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Monday it is offering a money-back guarantee on the fruits and vegetables it sells at its Walmart U.S. stores as it tries to gain more ground in the grocery business.,June 3 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said onMonday it is offering a money-back guarantee on the fruits andvegetables it sells at its Walmart U.S. stores as it tries togain more ground in the grocery business.

Title: Fitch Rates Walmart's $5 Billion Notes Issuance 'AA'
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)CHICAGO, April 05 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a rating of'AA' to Wal-Mart Stores, Inc.'s (Walmart) $5 billion issue of 3-, 5-,10- and 30-year senior notes. Proceeds from the issuance will be used to repayshort-term borrowings and other general corporate purposes.  The RatingOutlook is Stable. A full ratings list is provided at the end of this release.Key Rating Drivers:The rating reflects Walmart's dominant market posit

Body: FAYETTEVILLE, Arkansas Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  board approved a $15 billion stock repurchase plan, its first in two years, the world's largest retailer announced at its annual meeting on Friday.,FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., June 7 Wal-Mart Stores Inc announced a new $15 billion repurchase plan at itsannual meeting on Friday and emphasized the advancementopportunities its workers have, even as a small but vocal groupof workers complained that they cannot make enough money workingfor the world's largest retailer.,FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., June 7 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Friday its board approved a new $15 billionstock repurchase program, the first in two years.,June 6 The day after Wal-Mart Stores Inc published Simco Group's name on its list of banned Bangladeshsuppliers, the garment maker learned it had lost an order fromU.S. retailer J.C. Title: UPDATE 1-H&R Block gains share in digital, to exit Walmart stores
Body: June 12 H&R Block Inc said its marketshare continued to grow in the competitive digital tax filingbusiness even as total tax returns fell in an "abnormal" U.S.tax season.

Title: Wal-Mart CEO, others again get many 'No' votes from shareholders,Wal-Mart CEO, others again get many "No" votes from shareholders
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  shareholders approved the election of all 14 director nominees at the company's annual meeting last week, but many again voted against Chief Executive Michael Duke and others as the company continued to face fallout from a Mexican bribery scandal.,June 10 Wal-Mart Stores Inc shareholdersapproved the election of all 14 director nominees at thecompany's annual meeting last week, but many again voted againstChief Executive Michael Duke and others as the company continuedto face fallout from a Mexican bribery scandal.

Title: Exclusive: Banks vie to run Wal-Mart's coveted $15 billion retirement plan
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc is considering bids from retirement plan managers to run its $15.6 billion 401(k) program, which has been administered by Bank of America's Merrill Lynch unit for 15 years, according to three sources familiar with the situation.

Title: Stock price drop takes glow off U.S. consumer sentiment
Body: WASHINGTON Worries about rising interest rates and falling stock prices dinged U.S. consumer sentiment in early July, while other data showed a firm rise in wholesale prices, which could make the Federal Reserve more comfortable reducing its monetary stimulus.

Title: Suspect arrested after shooting at Atlanta-area school; no injuries
Body: ATLANTA Police arrested a 19-year-old man on Tuesday for opening fire with an AK-47 inside an elementary school in the Atlanta suburbs, forcing the evacuation of 800 students who were all reunited with their parents without injury, officials said.

Title: Suspect arrested after shooting at Atlanta-area school; no injuries
Body: ATLANTA Police arrested a 20-year-old man on Tuesday for opening fire with an AK-47 inside an elementary school in the Atlanta suburbs, forcing the evacuation of 800 students who were all reunited with their parents without injury, officials said.

Body: * Wal-Mart slumps after sales decline; Cisco drags on techshares,Wal-Mart Stores Inc  reported a surprise decline in quarterly same-store sales in the United States, its biggest market, after shoppers came in less often because higher taxes and gasoline prices were leaving them with less spending money. |Â ,* Wal-Mart slumps after results; Cisco drags on technology,Aug 15 Wal-Mart Stores Inc reported asurprise decline in quarterly same-store sales in the UnitedStates, its biggest market, after shoppers came in less oftenbecause higher taxes and gasoline prices were leaving them withless spending money.,NEW YORK, Aug 15 U.S. stocks fell on Thursday,as investors weighed disappointing results from blue chipsWal-Mart and Cisco, along with sturdy economic data that lookedset to place the Federal Reserve on a path soon toward scalingback its stimulus.,Department store chain Kohl's Corp  reported a rise in quarterly comparable-store sales, boosting its shares, after downbeat sales reports from Wal-Mart Stores Inc  and Macy's Inc  raised fears of a slowdown in consumer spending.,* 2nd-quarter earnings/share $1.04, in line with estimates,NEW YORK, Aug 15 U.S. stocks opened lower onThursday on continued uncertainty over the next policy move bythe Federal Reserve and after Wal-Mart earnings disappointed.The Nasdaq fell more than 1 percent, dragged down by shares ofCisco.,August 15 Canadian main stock index futurespointed to a lower open on Thursday, after closing flat in theprevious session, as lack of clarity about the Federal Reserve'smonetary stimulus program kept inventors on edge.,NEW YORK, Aug 15 U.S. stock index futures fellon Thursday on continued uncertainty over when, and how quickly,the Federal Reserve will begin to wind down its program tostimulate the world's largest economy.

Title: Wal-Mart to unveil new service with electronic payments provider,Wal-Mart to unveil new service with electronic payments provider,Fitch Rates Wal-Mart Stores' $2.5B Note Issuance 'AA'
Body: NEW YORK Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Wednesday that it will announce a new service with electronic payments provider Euronet Worldwide Inc on Thursday, but gave no other details.,NEW YORK, April 16 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said on Wednesday that it will announce a new service withelectronic payments provider Euronet Worldwide Inc onThursday, but gave no other details.,(The following statement was released by the rating agency)CHICAGO, April 16 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned an 'AA'rating to Wal-Mart Stores, Inc.'s (Walmart) $2.5 billion note issuance, consistingof:--$500 million of 1% notes due 2017;--$1 billion of 3.3% notes due 2024; and --1 billion of 4.3% notes due 2044. The Rating Outlook is Stable. The proceeds from the issuancewill be used for general corporate purposes. A full list of ratings follows atthe end of this release.KEY RATI

Title: Truck driver in Tracy Morgan 'drowsy driving' crash due in court,Truck driver in Tracy Morgan 'drowsy driving' crash due in court
Body: NEW YORK A Georgia truck driver accused of causing a fatal car crash on a New Jersey highway that critically injured comedian Tracy Morgan was due in court on Wednesday to face charges of vehicular homicide while driving with too little sleep.,NEW YORK A Georgia truck driver accused of causing a fatal car crash on a New Jersey highway that critically injured comedian Tracy Morgan was due in court on Wednesday to face charges of vehicular homicide while driving with too little sleep.

Title: Wal-Mart China to raise food safety spending to $48 million,Wal-Mart China to raise food safety spending to $48 million,UPDATE 1-Wal-Mart China to raise food safety spending to $48 million,Wal-Mart China to increase food safety spending to $48 million
Body: BEIJING The world's biggest retailer, Wal-Mart Stores Inc, said on Tuesday that it will increase its spending on food safety in China to 300 million yuan ($48.32 million) in 2013, 2014 and 2015, up from a previously-announced 100 million yuan in the same period.,BEIJING The world's biggest retailer, Wal-Mart Stores Inc , said on Tuesday that it will increase its spending on food safety in China to 300 million yuan ($48.32 million) in 2013, 2014 and 2015, up from a previously-announced 100 million yuan in the same period.,(Adds comment, background on Wal-Mart and food safety concernsin China),BEIJING, June 17 The world's biggest retailer,Wal-Mart Stores Inc, said on Tuesday that it willincrease its spending on food safety in China to 300 millionyuan ($48.32 million) in 2013, 2014 and 2015, up from apreviously-announced 100 million yuan in the same period.

Title: Inspection tensions add to Bangladesh garment industry's woes

Title: Three dead, two wounded in shooting attack on Las Vegas police
Body: LAS VEGAS Two armed suspects shouting "this is a revolution" opened fire on two Las Vegas police officers eating lunch in a pizza parlor on Sunday, then shot and killed a civilian inside a nearby Wal-Mart store before killing themselves, police said.

Title: Robust manufacturing output buoys U.S. economic outlook
Body: WASHINGTON U.S. manufacturing output rose broadly in July and automobile production recorded its largest increase in five years, boosting the economy at the start of the third quarter.

Body: Sept 23 Snow Glow Elsa has a big job ahead ofher - even for a princess with magical powers.

Title: Ohio grand jury decides not to charge officers in Walmart shooting
Body: An Ohio grand jury on Wednesday decided not to press charges against two police officers who fatally shot a man while he held a pellet gun at a Dayton-area Walmart in August, prosecutors said.

Title: U.S. consumer sentiment ends at 14-month high in September
Body: NEW YORK U.S. consumer sentiment finished September at its strongest in more than a year on growing optimism about the economy and more favorable outlook on future income, a survey released on Friday showed.

Title: Some U.S. retailers shun Apple Pay, eye rival payments system
Body: CHICAGO Some large U.S. retailers are refusing to use Apple Inc's  new electronic payments service as they commit to developing a rival payments system that would bolster their profits by eliminating credit card transaction fees. |Â

Title: Wal-Mart India appoints Murali Lanka operations chief
Body: MUMBAI, Oct 24 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's India unit said it had appointed company veteran Murali Lanka tothe newly created position of chief operations officer to leadstore operations and business development in the world's secondmost populous country.

Title: Wal-Mart to focus on food safety in China: Asia chief
Body: BEIJING Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is focusing on food safety as the world's largest retailer aims to boost profitability of its more than 400 stores in China, Wal-Mart Asia chief executive Scott Price told Reuters.

Title: Cargill recalls possibly tainted beef sold at Canadian Walmarts,UPDATE 2-Cargill recalls possibly tainted beef sold at Canadian Walmarts,Some Cargill beef sold at Wal-Mart may have e-coli - Canadian agency
Body: TORONTO/WINNIPEG, Manitoba Cargill [CARG.UL], Canada's biggest beef processor, is recalling ground beef sold by Wal-Mart Stores Inc  that may be contaminated with E. coli, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) said on Tuesday.,TORONTO/WINNIPEG, Manitoba, Dec 2 Cargill, Canada's biggest beef processor, is recalling groundbeef sold by Wal-Mart Stores Inc that may becontaminated with E. coli, the Canadian Food Inspection Agency(CFIA) said on Tuesday.,TORONTO, Dec 2 Some ground beef sold by Wal-MartStores Inc in Canada may be contaminated with E. coli,the Canadian Food Inspection Agency said on Tuesday, as meatproducer Cargill recalled the products.

Title: Attorney says actor Tracy Morgan struggling after crash: report
Body: An attorney for comedian Tracy Morgan said on Tuesday he was struggling to return "to the way he was" after suffering a serious brain injury in a New Jersey highway crash, a newspaper reported.

Title: After years of doubts, Americans turn more bullish on economy
Body: WASHINGTON Pessimism and doubt have dominated how Americans see the economy for many years. Now, in a hopeful sign for the economic outlook, confidence is suddenly perking up.

Title: Wal-Mart de Mexico board names Ostale new CEO,Wal-Mart de Mexico board names Ostale new CEO

Title: Microsoft Xbox Live back up, Sony PlayStation Network still down
Body: Microsoft Corp's Xbox Live was back up on Friday while Sony Corp's PlayStation Network remained offline for a second day after a hacker group claimed responsibility for attacking the two Internet gaming services. |Â

Title: Girlfriend of man shot by Ohio police in Walmart dies in car crash
Body: The girlfriend of a man shot dead by police while he was holding a BB gun at an Ohio Walmart has died in a car accident, a lawyer for the man's family said on Friday.

Title: Asda rejigs management ahead of tough year for UK retailers
Body: LONDON, Jan 14 Andy Clarke, head of Wal-MartStores Inc's British supermarket arm Asda, has rejiggedmanagement to help position the company ahead of what he expectsto be one of the toughest-ever years for retailers in Britain.

Title: Breakingviews: Wal-Mart's gun sales are shareholders' business
Body: NEW YORK, Feb 9 (Reuters Breakingviews) - Wal-Mart Stores' gun sales are shareholders' business. The U.S.mega-retailer claims a Wall Street church's request for anarms-peddling policy is overly meddlesome. Add that to the listof excuses companies use to keep investor ideas off proxyballots. True, lots of proposals are far out, but ones thatraise issues that can affect investors deserve a vote. It's upto the Securities and Exchange Commission to define thedifference.

Title: U.S. consumer inflation firming; new home sales at seven-year high
Body: WASHINGTON U.S. consumer prices rebounded in February as gasoline prices rose for the first time since June, and there were also signs of an uptick in underlying inflation pressures, keeping the Federal Reserve on course to raise interest rates this year. |Â

Title: States ask U.S. Congress to launch inquiry of herbal supplements
Body: NEW YORK A group of 14 state attorneys generalon Thursday asked the U.S. Congress to investigate the herbalsupplements industry after a New York probe of the productsturned up ingredients that were not listed on labels and raisedsafety concerns.

Body: PICO RIVERA, California/CHICAGO A union on Monday asked the National Labor Relations Board to force Wal-Mart to reinstate employees at five stores, accusing the retailer of closing the locations to retaliate against workers for attempts to organize for better pay and benefits.

Title: Wage increases in focus ahead of retail earnings
Body: Labor expenses will be a key focus during retailers' earnings conference calls in the coming weeks, with many companies under pressure to boost workers' wages at a time when low U.S. unemployment levels have given workers more leverage.

Title: Wal-Mart challenges Amazon with unlimited shipping service for $50 per year,Wal-Mart challenges Amazon with unlimited shipping service for $50 per year,Exclusive: Wal-Mart improves lobbying disclosure after shareholder push
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc is planning to test a new unlimited online shipping service this summer for $50 per year, a move that may hurt Amazon's annual $99 Prime shipping service.,CHICAGO, May 13 Wal-Mart Stores Inc isplanning to test a new unlimited online shipping service thissummer for $50 per year, a move that may hurt Amazon's annual$99 Prime shipping service.,CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores  said it will start disclosing directly to investors what it spends on lobbying on a state-by-state basis, responding to shareholder pressure to improve transparency on how the retailing giant seeks to influence public policy.

Title: 6th Circuit says post-Dukes suit against Wal-Mart was timely
Body: A U.S. appeals court on Tuesday revived genderdiscrimination claims by a group of Wal-Mart Stores Incemployees who were involved in the landmark Wal-Mart v. Dukescase before the U.S. Supreme Court, rejecting the retail giant'sclaim that the suit was untimely.

Title: CEO, chairman quit Wal-Mart's China e-commerce firm Yihaodian,CEO, chairman quit Wal-Mart's China e-commerce firm Yihaodian
Body: BEIJING/SHANGHAI The CEO and Chairman of Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Chinese e-commerce company Yihaodian.com have quit "to pursue their next venture", the U.S. retailer said on Wednesday, as it aims to grow a company still far smaller than local rivals.,BEIJING/SHANGHAI, July 15 The CEO and Chairmanof Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Chinese e-commerce companyYihaodian.com have quit "to pursue their next venture", the U.S.retailer said on Wednesday, as it aims to grow a company stillfar smaller than local rivals.

Title: Sainsbury's overtakes Asda to become UK's No.2 supermarket,UPDATE 2-Sainsbury's overtakes Asda to become UK's No.2 supermarket,UK's 'big four' grocers lose more ground to discounters - Kantar
Body: LONDON Asda, the British arm of U.S. retailer Wal-Mart , on Tuesday lost its status as Britain's No. 2 supermarket group to rival Sainsbury's  as industry data confirmed it as the sector laggard.,* Asda sales fall 2.7 pct in 12 weeks to July 19 - Kantar    * Sainsbury's now No. 2 player - Kantar    * Analysts say pressure mounting on Asda CEO Andy Clarke    * Asda says focused on long term (Adds statement from Asda)    By James Davey    LONDON, July 28 Asda, the British arm of U.S.retailer Wal-Mart, on Tuesday lost its status asBritain's No. 2 supermarket group to rival Sainsbury's as industry data confirmed it as the sector laggard.    Asda's sales fell 2.7 percen,LONDON, July 28 All of Britain's so-called "bigfour" supermarkets saw sales fall over the last 12 weeks in anoverall market that grew marginally, with discounters continuingto take share from their bigger rivals, industry data showed onTuesday.

Title: Consumer spending bolsters U.S. second-quarter growth
Body: WASHINGTON U.S. economic growth accelerated in the second quarter as solid consumer spending offset the drag from weak business spending on equipment, suggesting a steady momentum that could bring the Federal Reserve closer to hiking interest rates this year. |Â

Title: New York settles lawsuits on online sales of real-looking toy guns,UPDATE 1-New York settles lawsuits on online sales of real-looking toy guns
Body: NEW YORK A handful of large U.S. onlineretailers including Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Amazon.comInc have agreed to pay more than $300,000 in fines forselling realistic-looking toy guys to New York residents, thestate's attorney general said on Monday.,NEW YORK, Aug 3 A handful of large U.S. onlineretailers including Wal-Mart Stores Inc and Amazon.comInc have agreed to pay more than $300,000 in fines forselling realistic-looking toy guys to New York residents, thestate's attorney general said on Monday.

Title: Tired, speeding driver held responsible for 2014 Tracy Morgan crash,UPDATE 3-Tired, speeding driver held responsible for 2014 Tracy Morgan crash
Body: WASHINGTON A speeding Wal-Mart truck driver who had been awake for 28 hours was held responsible on Tuesday for a 2014 highway crash that left "30 Rock" star Tracy Morgan with brain injuries and killed a fellow comedian, U.S. transport regulators said.,WASHINGTON, Aug 11 A speeding Wal-Mart truck driver who had been awake for 28 hours was heldresponsible on Tuesday for a 2014 highway crash that left "30Rock" star Tracy Morgan with brain injuries and killed a fellowcomedian, U.S. transport regulators said.

Title: Sam's Club seeks to boost auto business with TrueCar tie-up
Body: Sept 3 Sam's Club, the membership warehouse clubdivision of Wal-Mart Stores Inc, said on Thursday it hastied up with online car-shopping site TrueCar Inc in aneffort to boost its auto business.

Title: Microsoft, Amazon video to join Disney's cloud movie service
Body: Sept 8 Walt Disney Co's studio unit saidcustomers of Amazon.com Inc and Microsoft Corp's video services will get access to the collection on itscloud-based movie storage service from Tuesday.

Title: Exclusive: Wal-Mart presses suppliers to share benefits of cheaper yuan
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is seeking price cuts from suppliers that produce goods in China, saying the retailer should share in the savings generated by China's devaluation of the yuan, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Title: Exclusive: Wal-Mart presses suppliers to share benefits of cheaper yuan
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  is seeking price cuts from suppliers that produce goods in China, saying the retailer should share in the savings generated by China's devaluation of the yuan, people with knowledge of the matter said.

Title: J. Crew says Walmart swiped jewelry designs
Body: Walmart sold showy jewelry pieces that "obviously copied"several of its designs, apparel company J. Crew told a federalcourt on Friday in a new lawsuit accusing one of the world'slargest retailers of willfully infringing its copyrights.

Body: WASHINGTON The Federal Trade Commission, whichenforces U.S. laws against deceptive ads, said Tuesday that ithad closed a probe of Wal-Mart Stores Inc after thecompany addressed the problem of products advertised as "Made inUSA" when they were not.,WASHINGTON The Federal Trade Commission, which enforces U.S. laws against deceptive ads, said Tuesday that it had closed a probe of Wal-Mart Stores Inc after the company addressed the problem of products advertised as "Made in USA" when they were not.,WASHINGTON, Oct 20 The Federal Trade Commission,which enforces U.S. laws against deceptive ads, said Tuesdaythat it had closed a probe of Wal-Mart Stores Inc afterthe company addressed the problem of products advertised as"Made in USA" when they were not.

Title: Exclusive: Wal-Mart seeks to test drones for home delivery, pickup

Title: Gender bias lawsuit against Wal-Mart can proceed after high court denies review
Body: The Supreme Court on Monday rejected Wal-Mart's bid tooverturn a federal appeals court decision allowing femaleworkers to sue the retail giant for paying women less and givingthem fewer promotions than men.

Title: Former Wal-Mart workers can sue over late pay - 9th Circuit
Body: A federal appeals court on Monday revived a proposed classaction against Wal-Mart Stores Inc, ruling that former workerscan seek penalties under Nevada wage law for late payment ofovertime to departing workers.

Title: Wal-Mart, Best Buy winners as holiday shopping season kicks off
Body: Nov 28 Wal-Mart, Target and Best Buy - and,unsurprisingly, Amazon.com - were early winners as shopperskicked off the holiday shopping season by splurging onelectronics such as ultra-HD TVs and gaming consoles includingSony's PlayStation 4, analysts said.

Title: Wal-Mart's tortoise-like digital pace may pay off
Body: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Wal-Mart Stores' tortoise-like digital pace may yet pay off. The $218 billion retailer is making some strides with its e-commerce efforts as sales increase. August's $3 bln purchase of Jet.com will accelerate the push to compete with Amazon. Patchy customer service and a brick-and-mortar image are some of the remaining hurdles to the plodding retailer's online success.

Title: Wal-Mart, General Motors reaffirm jobs long planned, Trump says thanks,WRAPUP 1-Wal-Mart, GM reaffirm jobs long planned, Trump says thanks,UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart pledges to keep hiring pace in U.S. this year,Wal-Mart to add 10,000 U.S. jobs in 2017,BRIEF-Wal-Mart Stores plans $6.8 bln of capital investments in U.S. in coming year
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  and General Motors Co  on Tuesday became the latest companies to win praise from President-elect Donald Trump for adding U.S. jobs and investment, even though much of their plans were previously announced. |Â ,Jan 17 Wal-Mart Stores Inc and GeneralMotors Co on Tuesday became the latest companies to winpraise from President-elect Donald Trump for adding U.S. jobsand investment, even though much of their plans were previouslyannounced.,Jan 17 Wal-Mart Stores Inc will createabout 10,000 jobs in the United States this year as part of apreviously announced plan, it said on Tuesday, asPresident-elect Donald Trump puts pressure on companies to hiremore U.S. workers.,Jan 17 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said it wouldadd about 10,000 jobs in the United States this year through theopening or remodeling of 59 stores as well as through itse-commerce business.,* Is planning $6.8 billion of capital investments in U.S. incoming fiscal year

Title: U.S. department stores steady profitability boat even as sales slide
Body: CHICAGO, Jan 20 U.S. department store chains,hit by slowing sales for more than two years, have used layoffs,store closings and cutbacks to maintain one aspect of stability:profit margins.

Title: Activision Blizzard creates consumer products division
Body: Feb 1 Activision Blizzard Inc said onWednesday it was creating a consumer products division to tapinto the popularity of its videogame franchises, including "Callof Duty", "Overwatch" and "World of Warcraft".

Title: Wal-Mart aims to leverage British arm Asda back to health,Wal-Mart aims to leverage British arm Asda back to health
Body: LONDON Wal-Mart  is throwing its weight as the world's largest retailer behind its struggling British arm Asda after admitting it was too slow to respond effectively to the threat posed by the discount supermarkets.,* Parent Wal-Mart says was too slow to respond todiscounters

Title: Wal-Mart offers free two-day shipping in latest attempt to compete with Amazon,Wal-Mart offers free two-day shipping in latest attempt to compete with Amazon
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  will offer U.S. shoppers free two-day shipping on a minimum order of $35 starting Tuesday, its latest attempt to compete with rival Amazon.com Inc's  popular Prime shipping program.,CHICAGO, Jan 31 Wal-Mart Stores Inc willoffer U.S. shoppers free two-day shipping on a minimum order of$35 starting Tuesday, its latest attempt to compete with rivalAmazon.com Inc's popular Prime shipping program.

Title: Exclusive: Wal-Mart to tear down walls between store, online buying operations - sources
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  for the first time will combine its own buying for products sold at its stores with purchases it makes for its website, sources said, a significant move to stamp out duplicate efforts as it consolidates buying operations to better fight Amazon.com Inc .

Title: Price war triggers Kroger's first same-store sales drop in 13 years
Body: Supermarket operator Kroger Co  surprised analysts with its first quarterly same-store sales decline in 13 years, as competition intensified in the U.S. grocery industry, sending its shares down as much as 5.6 percent on Thursday. |Â

Title: Price war triggers Kroger's first same-store sales drop in 13 years
Body: Supermarket operator Kroger Co  surprised analysts with its first quarterly same-store sales decline in 13 years, as competition intensified in the U.S. grocery industry, sending its shares down as much as 5.6 percent on Thursday. |Â

Title: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1-Walmex to increase spending by 19 percent in 2017
Body: MEXICO CITY, March 14 Wal-Mart de Mexico, Mexico's biggest retailer, plans to increasespending by nearly 19 percent in 2017, upgrading and adding newstores and investing in e-commerce, a top executive said onTuesday.

Title: Wal-Mart supplier recalls U.S. frozen pizzas over possible listeria
Body: CHICAGO A Wal-Mart Stores Inc  supplier has recalled frozen pizzas available in 11 U.S. states due to concerns about possible listeria contamination, according to the retailer and the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

Title: Delaware Supreme Court revives derivative suit over Wal-Martâ€™s Mexican payments
Body: Late Wednesday, the Delaware Supreme Court gave at least a temporary reprieve to a derivative suit accusing Wal-Mart board members of breaching their duties in response to allegations of bribery by corporate executives in Mexico. The justices remanded the case to Chancery Court with instructions that Chancellor Andre Bouchard entertain briefing on the constitutional due process rights of the shareholders who filed the suit.

Title: Massmart to step up expansion outside South Africa as profit jumps
Body: JOHANNESBURG South African retailer Massmart plans to increase its stores outside its home market by more than a quarter in the next two years, the company said on Thursday as it reported an almost 16 percent rise in full-year profit.

Body: SANTIAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  Chilean unit will invest $800 million in the country over the next three years and open 55 to 60 new supermarkets, the company said on Wednesday, a significant outlay at a time of slow economic growth.,SANTIAGO, March 22 Wal-Mart Stores Inc'sChilean unit will invest $800 million in the country over thenext three years and open 55 to 60 new supermarkets, the companysaid on Wednesday, a significant outlay at a time of sloweconomic growth.,SANTIAGO, March 22 The Chilean unit of Wal-MartStores Inc will invest $800 million in the country overthe next three years and will open 55 to 60 new supermarkets,the company said in a press release on Wednesday.,* No.1 hypermarket chain Sun Art removes Brazil beef fromstores

Title: Walmex completes sale of clothing chain Suburbia to Liverpool,Walmex completes sale of clothing chain Suburbia to Liverpool
Body: MEXICO CITY Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  Mexican unit said on Tuesday it had completed the sale of its clothing chain Suburbia to department store and shopping mall operator El Puerto De Liverpool  for 15.7 billion pesos ($834 million).,MEXICO CITY, April 4 Wal-Mart Stores Inc'sMexican unit said on Tuesday it had completed the saleof its clothing chain Suburbia to department store and shoppingmall operator El Puerto De Liverpool for 15.7billion pesos ($834 million).

Title: Wal-Mart eliminates more corporate jobs,Wal-Mart continues to eliminate corporate jobs -report
Body: CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Tuesday it is eliminating more U.S. corporate jobs this month, even as it invests in improving its e-commerce operations and in regaining its low-cost pricing advantage in the U.S. retail sector.,CHICAGO, April 11 Wal-Mart Stores Inc iseliminating more corporate jobs this month, the Wall StreetJournal reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with thematter.

Title: Wal-Mart seeks online fashion presence through acquisitions,Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions,Wal-Mart seeks online fashion presence through acquisitions
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc's bid for clothingretailer Bonobos, which surfaced last week, is the latest stepin the company's attempt to recover lost ground againstAmazon.com Inc and others in the rapidly growing onlinefashion world, analysts and retail consultants said.,April 17 The following bids, mergers, acquisitions and disposalswere reported by 2000 GMT on Monday:,Wal-Mart Stores Inc's bid for clothing retailer Bonobos, which surfaced last week, is the latest step in the company's attempt to recover lost ground against Amazon.com Inc and others in the rapidly growing online fashion world, analysts and retail consultants said.

Title: Wal-Mart CEO to be questioned in U.S. lawsuit over Mexican bribery
Body: A federal judge on Thursday ordered Wal-Mart Stores Inc Chief Executive Douglas McMillon to submit to questioning in a lawsuit by shareholders hoping to learn what he knows about suspected bribery by the world's largest retailer in Mexico.

Body: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark., June 2 Wal-Mart Stores Incexecutives on Friday reassured workers they remainedintegral to the company's success as they highlightedinvestments in online sales and other technology to compete withrivals like Amazon.com Inc.

Title: Wal-Mart reassures employees as it touts tech investments
Body: FAYETTEVILLE, Ark. Wal-Mart Stores Inc executives on Friday reassured workers they remained integral to the company's success as they highlighted investments in online sales and other technology to compete with rivals like Amazon.com Inc. |Â

Title: Wal-Mart to buy Bonobos, but shares dip on Amazon-Whole Foods deal,US STOCKS-Wall St dips as Amazon-Whole Foods deal roils retail,GLOBAL MARKETS-U.S. stocks fall after Amazon deal news; dollar weakens,UPDATE 3-Wal-Mart to buy Bonobos, but shares dip on Amazon-Whole Foods deal,Wal-Mart to buy Bonobos for $310 mln,BRIEF-Wal Mart to acquire Bonobos for $310 mln
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc  said on Friday it would buy online men's fashion retailer Bonobos Inc for $310 million, in its fourth e-commerce deal in under a year, as it seeks to bridge the gap with e-commerce leader Amazon.com Inc .,* Dow up 0.03 pct, S&P down 0.07 pct, Nasdaq down 0.15 pct(Updates to late afternoon),* Bond yields also down after data; oil edges higher(Updates with U.S. trading; changes dateline, previous LONDON),June 16 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said onFriday it would buy online men's fashion retailer Bonobos Incfor $310 million, in its fourth e-commerce deal in under a year,as it seeks to bridge the gap with e-commerce leader Amazon.comInc.,June 16 Wal-Mart Stores Inc said itwould buy online men's fashion retailer Bonobos Inc for $310million in cash.,* Wal Mart to acquire Bonobos and appoint Andy Dunn tooversee exclusive consumer brands offered online

Body: CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO, June 19 When Wal-MartStores Inc bought online retailer Jet.com for $3 billionlast year, it marked a crucial moment - the world's largestbrick-and-mortar retailer, after years of ceding e-commerceleadership to arch rival Amazon, intended to compete.,CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO, June 18 When Wal-MartStores Inc bought online retailer Jet.com for $3 billionlast year, it marked a crucial moment - the world's largestbrick-and-mortar retailer, after years of ceding e-commerceleadership to arch rival Amazon, intended to compete.

Title: Amazon's one-click deal keeps Wal-Mart at bay,RPT-With Whole Foods, Amazon on collision course with Wal-Mart
Body: DALLAS (Reuters Breakingviews) - Wal-Martâ€™s market capitalization dropped 5 percent, losing $11 billion, after Amazon.com unveiled its $14 billion deal to buy Whole Foods Market on Friday. Meanwhile, Whole Foods shares closed on Friday nearly 2 percent above the agreed price, implying some investors think a rival bid could emerge. But even for Wal-Mart, that would be a stretch.,CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO, June 19 When Wal-MartStores Inc bought online retailer Jet.com for $3 billionlast year, it marked a crucial moment - the world's largestbrick-and-mortar retailer, after years of ceding e-commerceleadership to arch rival Amazon, intended to compete.

Title: Wal-Mart pays $1.65 million to resolve improper drug-billing claims
Body: Wal-Mart Stores Inc has agreed to pay $1.65 million toresolve claims that it violated federal law by submitting claimsfor reimbursement to California's Medicaid healthcare programthat were not supported by diagnosis and documentationrequirements.

Title: BRIEF-Wal Mart files preliminary prospectus supplement,Exclusive: Wal-Mart not considering a bid for Whole Foods - source
Body: * Files preliminary prospectus supplement related topotential two-part yen denominated notes offering  - sec filingSource text: (http://bit.ly/2rLpbcb)Further company coverage:,Wal-Mart Stores Inc is not actively considering making an offer for Whole Foods Market Inc, a source familiar with the matter told Reuters on Friday.

Title: Wal-Mart's South African arm Massmart reports drop in like-for-like sales
Body: JOHANNESBURG, May 25 South African-basedretailer Massmart, majority-owned by Wal-Mart Inc, reported on Thursday a near 2 percent fall in overallsame-store sales in the first five months of the current year,as outlets outside its home market underperformed.

Title: Federal judge rejects Walmart's bid to scuttle worker's religious bias lawsuit
Body: A federal judge in Manhattan ruled on Tuesday that Wal-MartStores Inc reasonably accommodated a Pentecostal workerâ€™srequest to take Sundays off for religious reasons, but said ajury should decide whether the retail giant violated anti-biaslaw by denying her 17 bids for a promotion.

Title: NLRB says Walmart's response to work stoppage was illegal
Body: The National Labor Relations Board has urged a federalappeals court to uphold the agency's decision that said Wal-MartStores Inc unlawfully threatened and disciplined workers whoparticipated in a brief work stoppage at a California store.
